description:
UMD 3.11.0 is the eleventh update of the third Major release of UMD 
(Unified Middleware Distribution) made available for the EGI production 
infrastructure. This release contains support for both Scientific Linux 5
 and 6 and also Debian 6 (Squeeze).
releaseNotes:
This release contains the following products:<br><br>Accounting<br><ul><li><b>APEL, v. 1.3.1,</b> versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>Corrected the handling of multiple FQANs in blah logs so that the role 
and group are taken from the first (i.e. primary) FQAN rather than the 
last. This will impact the summarising of job records when there are 
multiple roles and groups listed.</li><li>Added support for parsing fractional seconds in XML usage records.</li></ul><li> For more details see <a href="https://github.com/apel/apel/blob/1.3.1-1/CHANGELOG">Extended Changelog</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>APEL SSM, v. 2.1.5,</b> versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues like:</li><ul><li> The highest version of SSL/TLS available is now used (previously only SSL 3.0).</li><li> Minor tweaks made to logging calls and the logging level of certain messages.</li></ul><li> For more details see <a href="https://github.com/apel/ssm/blob/2.1.5-1/CHANGELOG">Extended Changelog</a></li></ul></ul><p>Attribute authority</p><ul><li><b>VOMS server, v. 2.0.12 & VOMS-admin server, v. 3.3.1</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://italiangrid.github.io/voms/release-notes/voms-admin-server/3.3.1">VOMS-admin server 3.3.1 - Extended release notes</a></li><li>More details in the <a href="http://italiangrid.github.io/voms/release-notes/voms-server/2.0.12-2" target="_blank"> </a><a href="http://italiangrid.github.io/voms/release-notes/voms-server/2.0.12-2">VOMS server 2.0.12-2 - Extended release notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE XUUDB v. 2.1.2</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/xuudb/manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><p>Authentication</p><ul><li><b>Globus GSI  C & GSI-OpenSSH v. 6.0.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/rn/#rn">GT 6.0 Extended Release Notes</a> and <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/gsic/rn/#gsicRN">GSI C </a>and <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/gsiopenssh/rn/#gsiopensshRN">GSI-OpenSSH</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE-Gateway v. 7.2.0</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>fix: message charset was always ISO-8859-1, and UFT-8 characters were not properly transmitted (SF bug # 770)</li><li>initial support for multipart POST messages (but SOAP part must be first) (SF feature #292)</li><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/gateway/manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a><br></li></ul></ul><p>Client Tools<br></p><ul><li><b>GFAL2-util, v. 1.1.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>fix for is_alive is not available in Python 2.4 (EL5)</li><li>support input from file in gfal-copy and gfal-del</li><li>Create a cli around xattr+replicas to ease its use</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-util-1.1.0">Extended Release Notes</a><br></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>VOMS clients v. 3.0.6 & native 2.0.12-2 , VOMS Java APIs, v. 3.0.5</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features - more details at:</li><ul><li><a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-22-10-11-2014-v-3-13-0-1#VOMS_clients_v_3_0_5_native_2_0">Extended Release Notes</a></li><li><a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-23-16-12-2014-v-3-14-0-1#VOMS_clients_v_3_0_6_and_VOMS_Ja">Extended Release Notes (3.0.6)</a><br></li></ul></ul></ul><p>Credential management<br></p><ul><li><b>MyProxy, v. 6.1.10</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/rn/#rn-bycomponents">GT 6.0 Extended Release Notes</a> and <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/myproxy/rn/#myproxyRN">MyProxy Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1215"><b>gLite-ProxyRenewal v. 1.3.36</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1215">This is a rebuild of ProxyRenewal with the new major version of MyProxy 
(v. 6). There were updated manual pages. This revision also introduces 
packaging updates to better follow existing packaging guidelines, and 
missing runtime dependency on psmisc were added. <br></li><li id="aui_3_2_0_1215">For more details see <a href="https://github.com/CESNET/proxyrenewal/wiki/Px-release-page#PX_10261">PX 1.0.26-1 - Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul>Data Acces<br><ul><li><b>DAVIX, v. </b><b>0.4.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>Davix follows redirection automatically even though redirectionSupport is switched off</li><li>Davix: POODLE vulnerability CVE-2014-3566 affects libneon, then davix</li><li>DAVIX : implement a list bucket feature for davix on the opendir/readdir model</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/davix-040">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><p>File Access, File Transfer, Storage Management</p><ul><li><b>DPM/LFC, v. </b><b>1.8.9</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1306"> Extensive Logging Consolidation effort in the core components, the source structure, and the test infrastructure</li><li> Several high impact performance improvements in the core components In-memory caching of pool/fs info in DMLite adapter</li><li> Bye bye YAIM, welcome Puppet</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/blog/dpm_1.8.9_relnotes">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>FTS3, v. 3.2.30</b>, version for SL6:</li><ul><li>This is the first release in UMD of FTS3 - "the production FTS service for all the LHC experiments"</li><li>For more details see <a href="http://fts3-service.web.cern.ch/documentation/releases#FTS%203.2.30">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><p>
</p><ul><li><b>Frontier SQUID, v. 2.7STABLE9-21.1</b>, version for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This is the first release in UMD of Frontier SQUID </li><li>For more details see <a href="http://frontier.cern.ch/dist/rpms/frontier-squidRELEASE_NOTES">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>Globus GridFTP, v. 6.0</b>, version for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>For more details see the <a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/gridftp/rn/#gridftpRN">Extended Release Notes</a><br></li></ul></ul><p>Information Discovery</p><ul><li><b>Globus InfoProviderService, v. 0.2.1</b>, version for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>For more details see...</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE Registry v. 7.2.0</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/registry/registry-manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><p>Job Execution, Job Scheduling</p><ul><li><b>CREAM, v. </b><b>1.16.4</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides bug fixes:</li><ul><li>The CREAM service does not depends anymore on VOMS client 2.x</li><li>Use <a class="twikiLink" href="https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/EMI/VOMS">VOMS</a>/CanL APIs instead of <a class="twikiLink" href="https://twiki.cern.ch/twiki/bin/view/EMI/VOMS">VOMS</a> UI</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-21-09-10-2014-v-3-12-0-1#CREAM_v_1_16_4">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>Globus GRAM5, v. 6.0.1</b>, version for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>For more details see<a href="http://toolkit.globus.org/toolkit/docs/6.0/gram5/rn/#gram5RN"> Extended Release notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>QCG-Computing, v. 3.4.0</b>, versions for SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides </li><ul><li>Updated Java SDK to use JGlobus 2.0.8</li><li>Created RPM package for application scripts (qcg-appscripts)</li><li>Bug fixes<br></li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://www.qoscosgrid.org/trac/qcg-computing/export/HEAD/tags/current/RELEASE_NOTES#1">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE TSI v. 7.2.0</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>fixes</li><ul><li>newline characters in filenames break listDirectory (SF #769)</li><li>Slurm: remove extra "\n" when setting account</li><li>cleanup SSL code, make it more portable with respect to IPv6/IPv4. Use separate key and certificate files.</li><li>in non-SSL mode, configuring the tsi.njsport is mandatory</li></ul><li>updated docs on configuring SSL</li><li>added section on securing/hardening the TSI to the manual <br></li><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/tsi/tsi-manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>UNICORE/X v. 7.2.0</b>, versions for SL6 and Deb 6:</li><ul><li>new features: <br></li><ul><li>support Unity with OIDC (SF feature #344)</li><li>support S3 as backend storage (SF feature #342)<br></li></ul><li>fixes: <br></li><ul><li>data triggering could miss some files</li><li>file existence check (to compensate for slow filesystems) did not work (SF bug #762)</li><li>REST authentication: only first authentication option was used, SAML AuthN was buggy</li></ul><li>More details in the <a href="http://unicore.eu/documentation/manuals/unicore6/files/unicorex/unicorex-manual.html">Extended Release Notes & Documentation</a></li></ul></ul><p>Job Scheduling<br></p><ul><li><b>WMS v. 3.6.6-2</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li id="aui_3_2_0_1215"> This is a rebuild of WMS-ICE with the new major version of MyProxy (v. 6)</li></ul></ul>Messaging<br><ul><li><b>QCG-Notification, v. 3.4.0</b>, versions for SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides</li><ul><li>Disabled KEEP_ALIVE flag for the anonymous and SSL publishers.</li><li>Updated requirement for qcg-core to the version 3.4.0.</li><li>Minor fixes<br></li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://www.qoscosgrid.org/trac/qcg-notification/export/HEAD/tags/current/RELEASE_NOTES#1">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><br>Other<br><ul><li><b>BLAH v. 1.20.7</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release fixes the following bugs:
		</li><ul><li> <a href="https://issues.infn.it/jira/browse/CREAM-155">CREAM-155</a> - BUpdate interval does not work with GE</li><li> <a href="https://issues.infn.it/jira/browse/CREAM-152">CREAM-152</a> - Wrong condor_status renaming in postinst</li></ul></ul></ul><ul><li><b>CGSI-gSOAP, v. 1.3.7</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes:</li><ul><li>x509_* data members are leaking</li><li>CGSI-soap changes to be more verbose and meaningful</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/cgsi-gsoap-1.3.7">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>CREAM TORQUE module, v. 2.1.4</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This
 release provides bug fixes:</li><ul><li>Missing check in triggerun for lcg-info-dynamic-scheduler-pbs</li><li>TORQUE provider should publish undefined values</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-18-07-07-2014-v-3-9-0-1#CREAM_TORQUE_v_2_1_4">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><h3> <a name="Installation_Configuration_AN2"></a></h3><ul><li><b>CREAM GE module</b>,  <b>v. 2.3.2 </b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This release provides multiple bugfix afecting the info-dynamic-scheduler and also an improved Glue2 support</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>DMLITE, v. 0.7.2</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update provides:</li><ul><li>BugFix for too much verbose logging</li></ul><li>For more details see the <a href="https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/attachment/wiki/Dpm/dmlite0.7.2-relnotes.txt">Extended Release Notes</a> and <a href="https://svnweb.cern.ch/trac/lcgdm/blog/dmlite0.7.2_epelstable_setlogto1">More Details</a><br></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>GFAL2, v. 2.7.8</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>LFC Plugin: Calling gfal2_set_error with wrong parameters</li><li>Core: Cannot use unix special files as a destination for file transfer</li><li>Deprecate gfal_handle and gfal_context_t inside gfal2</li><li>GridFTP Plugin: Log storage IPv6</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-2.7.8">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>GFAL2-python, v. 1.6.0</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>Expose gfal_version in the Python wrappers</li><li> Pythonize names transfer_parameters and gfalt_event</li><li>Core: New method to load configuration from a file (gfal2_load_opts_from_file)</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/gfal2-python-1.6.0">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>SRM-ifce, v. 1.21.4</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li>This update fixes some issues and provides new features like:</li><ul><li>srm_xping and xrm_ping bad return codes on error</li><li> bring online timeout is not set correctly in gfal_srmv2_bring_online_internal</li><li>Add srm_xping, returning more information that srm_ping</li></ul><li>For more details see <a href="http://dmc.web.cern.ch/release/srm-ifce-1.21.4">Extended Release Notes</a></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>classads-libs, v. 1.0.10</b>, versions for SL5:</li><ul><li> New version in EPEL 5 with new maintainer (Frantisek Dvorak)<br></li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>edg-mkgridmap, v. 4.0.1</b>, versions for SL5 and SL6:</li><ul><li> No longer require SSLv3, allow TLS to be negotiated instead.</li><li> Relocation of source repository.</li><li id="aui_3_2_0_1969"> Cleanup for EPEL builds.</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>python-lockfile, v. 0.8.3</b>, version for SL5:</li><ul><li> package retired from EPEL 5 repos but needed as dependency by some middleware components</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>python-reportlab, v. 2.5.3</b>, version for SL5:</li><ul><li> package retired from EPEL 5 repos but needed as dependency by some middleware components</li></ul></ul><ul><li><b>SOAPpy, v. 0.11.6</b>, version for SL5:</li><ul><li> package retired from EPEL 5 repos but needed as dependency by some middleware components</li></ul></ul>
installationNotes:
All products in the UMD 3.11.0 release were verified against EGI's 
current&nbsp; Quality Criteria (for further information, please see the 
documentation links) to support Scientific Linux 5 and Scientific
 Linux 6 (x86_64 processor architecture). Some products are also 
supported in 64 bit Debian 6 (squeeze).&nbsp; Installation and configuration 
notes are available in the <a href="http://repository.egi.eu/category/umd_releases/distribution/umd-3/">EGI repository</a>.
contact:
For further information about the UMD, its goals and surrounding processes, and
more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please
send an Email to: cto (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release <br>notes of this UMD release, or the related documentation provided by the <br>Technology Providers, please visit the <a href="https://ggus.eu/">EGI Helpdesk</a> to make a report.
knownIssues: Details containing known issues and workarounds found in EGI verification and <br>staged rollout are collected in:<br><a href="https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.11.0">https://wiki.egi.eu/wiki/UMD-3:UMD-3.11.0</a>
changeLog:
This releases includes updates for the following products: APEL Clents &amp; SSM, CGSI-gSOAP, CREAM TORQUE module, CREAM GE module, CREAM, DAVIX, DPM, glite-ProxyRenewal, GFAL2, 
GFAL2-util, GFAL2-python, Globus Toolkit 6.0, FT3, Frontier SQUID, MyProxy, ProxyRenewal, QCG Computing, QCG Notifier, SRM-ifce, VOMS Server, Clients and APIs, WMS, UNICORE 7.2.0 ( X, XUUDB, Gateway, TSI, Registry)

products.name: apel.apel-ssm
products.description: http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-23-16-12-2014-v-3-14-0-1#APEL_SSM_v_2_1_5
products.releaseNotes:
The highest version of SSL/TLS available is now used (previously only SSL 3.0).
Minor tweaks made to logging calls and the logging level of certain messages.

products.name: apel.apel
products.description: http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-22-10-11-2014-v-3-13-0-1#APEL_Parsers_v_2_4_0_APEL_Publis
products.releaseNotes:
Corrected the handling of muliple FQANs in blah logs so that the role and group are taken from the first (i.e. primary) FQAN rather than the last.
Fixed a crash that occurred when the parser encountered an empty file.
Added support for parsing fractional seconds in XML usage records.
Fixed database loader crash when save_messages was set to false.
Added options to unloader.conf to allow the unloader to unload more than just the current and previous months.

products.name: cernfrontier.squid
products.description: The Frontier distributed database caching system uses a RESTful http-based protocol to distribute data queries. The LHC experiments ATLAS and CMS use it to access conditions data describing their complicated detectors, and cache the results at all the worldwide sites that process their particle collision data. This twiki site contains documentation for the software of the Frontier system that is not experiment-specific.

products.name: cesnet.px
products.description: http://egee.cesnet.cz/cvsweb/SEC/ProxyRenewal_AG.pdf
products.changeLog: This is a rebuild of ProxyRenewal with the new major version of MyProxy (v. 6).

products.name: dpm.dmlite
products.description:
The Disk Pool Manager (DPM) is a lightweight storage solution for grid sites. It offers a
simple way to create a disk-based grid storage element and supports relevant protocols
(SRM, gridFTP, RFIO) for file management and access. It focus on manageability (ease
of installation, configuration, low effort of maintenance), while providing all required
functionality for a grid storage solution (support for multiple disk server nodes,
different space types, multiple file replicas in disk pools).

products.name: dpm.dpm
products.description:
The Disk Pool Manager (DPM) is a lightweight storage solution for grid sites. It offers a
simple way to create a disk-based grid storage element and supports relevant protocols
(SRM, gridFTP, RFIO) for file management and access. It focus on manageability (ease
of installation, configuration, low effort of maintenance), while providing all required
functionality for a grid storage solution (support for multiple disk server nodes,
different space types, multiple file replicas in disk pools).

products.name: emi.classads-libs
products.description: introducing the classads libs missing from EPEL
products.releaseNotes: introducing the classads libs missing from EPEL
products.changeLog: introducing the classads libs missing from EPEL

products.name: emi.cream-ge
products.description: The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level. CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc). CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.

products.name: emi.cream-torque
products.description:
The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level.



CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc).



CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.

products.name: emi.cream
products.description:
The CREAM (Computing Resource Execution And Management) Service is a simple, lightweight service for job management operation at the Computing Element (CE) level.



CREAM accepts job submission requests (which are described with the same JDL language used to describe the jobs submitted to the Workload Management System) and other job management requests (e.g. job cancellation, job monitoring, etc).



CREAM can be used by the Workload Management System (WMS), via the ICE service, or by a generic client, e.g. an end-user willing to directly submit jobs to a CREAM CE. For the latter user case a command line interface (CLI) is available.

products.name: emi.voms-admin
products.description: The Virtual Organization Membership Service (VOMS) is an attribute authority which serves as central repository for VO user authorization information, providing support for sorting users into group hierarchies, keeping track of their roles and other attributes in order to issue trusted attribute certificates and SAML assertions used in the Grid environment for authorization purposes.
products.changeLog: VOMS server 2.0.12 which provides several bugfixes. In particular, some segfaults have been resolved and the server now correctly throttles incoming requests

products.description: http://www.eu-emi.eu/releases/emi-3-monte-bianco/updates/-/asset_publisher/5Na8/content/update-22-10-11-2014-v-3-13-0-1
products.changeLog: This is a rebuild of WMS-ICE with the new major version of MyProxy (v. 6)

products.description: davix is a C++ toolkit for advanced I/O on remote resources with HTTP based protocols.

products.name: fts3.fts3
products.description: FTS3 is the service responsible for globally distributing the majority of the LHC data across the WLCG infrastructure. Is a low level data movement service, responsible for reliable bulk transfer of files from one site to another while allowing participating sites to control the network resource usage

products.name: gfal2.gfal2
products.description: GFAL (Grid File Access Library ) is a C library providing an abstraction layer of the grid storage system complexity.

products.name: globus.globus-default-security
products.description: These components establish the identity of users or services (authentication), protect communications, and determine who is allowed to perform what actions (authorization), as well as manage user credentials.

products.name: globus.gram5
products.description: The Grid Resource Allocation and Management (GRAM5) interface as a basic mechanism for initiation, monitoring, management, scheduling, and/or coordination of remote computations.

products.name: globus.gridftp
products.description: GridFTP provides high-performance and reliable data transport.

products.name: globus.myproxy
products.description: MyProxy is open source software for managing X.509 Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) security credentials (certificates and private keys). MyProxy combines an online credential repository with an online certificate authority to allow users to securely obtain credentials when and where needed. Users run myproxy logon to authenticate and obtain credentials, including trusted CA certificates and Certificate Revocation Lists (CRLs).

products.name: ige.globus-info-provider-service
products.description: Globus generic info providers for BDII and YAIM configuration tool
products.releaseNotes: Globus generic info providers for BDII and YAIM configuration tool

products.name: infn.voms-clients
products.description: The Virtual Organization Membership Service (VOMS) is an attribute authority which serves as central repository for VO user authorization information, providing support for sorting users into group hierarchies, keeping track of their roles and other attributes in order to issue trusted attribute certificates and SAML assertions used in the Grid environment for authorization purposes.
products.changeLog: VOMS Clients 3.0.5 provide a new packaging which can coexist with the native, 2.0.12 clients (also released today).

products.name: infn.voms-clients

products.name: qcg.qcg-comp
products.description: QCG-Computing (formerly known as Smoa Computing) is an open architecture implementation of SOAP Web service for multi-user access and policy-based job control routines by various queuing and batch systems managing local computational resources

products.name: qcg.qcg-ntf
products.description: QCG-Notification is an open source implementation of the family of WS-Notification standards (Base Notification, Brokered Notification and Topics).

products.name: unicore.gateway
products.description: UNICORE (Uniform Interface to Computing Resources) offers a ready-to-run Grid system including client and server software. UNICORE makes distributed computing and data resources available in a seamless and secure way in intranets and the internet.
